019package org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.util;
020
021import static java.lang.Integer.signum;
022import static java.util.Objects.isNull;
023import static java.util.Objects.nonNull;
024import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.INTERNAL;
025import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.NOT_FOUND;
026import static org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.requireNonNullArgument;
027
028import java.util.Comparator;
029import java.util.List;
030
031import org.apiguardian.api.API;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit;
033import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.ToolKit.KeyProvider;
034import org.tquadrat.foundation.javadoc.internal.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
035
036/**
037 *  Sometimes a special sort order is required that cannot be defined as a rule.
038 *  Instead, a list defines the sequence.
039 *
040 *  @param  <T> The type to order.
041 *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may be
042 *      the same as the type itself.
043 *
044 *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
045 *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
046 *  @since 0.0.5
047 */
048@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
049@API( status = INTERNAL, since = "0.0.5" )
050public class ListBasedComparator<T,K> implements Comparator<T>
051{
052        /*---------------*\
053    ====** Inner Classes **====================================================
054        \*---------------*/
055    /**
056     *  A simple implementation of
057     *  {@code ToolKit.KeyProvider}
058     *  that returns the instance itself as the sort order key.
059     *
060     *  @author Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
061     *  @version $Id: ListBasedComparator.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $
062     *
063     *  @param  <T> The type to order.
064     *  @param  <K> The key type that is used to determine the order; this may
065     *      be the same as the type itself. At least, an instance of type
066     *      {@code T} must be assignable to {@code K}.
067     */
068    @ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ListBasedComparator.java 976 2022-01-06 11:39:58Z tquadrat $" )
069    private static class SimpleKeyProvider<T,K> implements KeyProvider<T,K>
070    {
071            /*--------------*\
072        ====** Constructors **=================================================
073            \*--------------*/
074        /**
075         *  Creates a new {@code SimpleKeyProvider} instance.
076         */
077        public SimpleKeyProvider() { /* Just exists */ }
078
079            /*---------*\
080        ====** Methods **======================================================
081            \*---------*/
082        /**
083         *  {@inheritDoc}
084         *
085         *  @return The instance itself as the sort order key; {@code null} if
086         *      the instance is {@code null} itself.
087         */
088        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
089        @Override
090        public final K getKey( final T instance ) { return (K) instance; }
091    }
092    //  class SimpleKeyProvider
093
094        /*------------*\
095    ====** Attributes **=======================================================
096        \*------------*/
097    /**
098     *  The comparator that is used to determine the sort order for instances
099     *  that do not have their keys in the list; may be {@code null}.
100     */
101    private final Comparator<? super T> m_Comparator;
102
103    /**
104     *  The key provider.
105     */
106    private final KeyProvider<T,K> m_KeyProvider;
107
108    /**
109     *  The list with the sort order keys.
110     */
111    private final K [] m_Keys;
112
113        /*--------------*\
114    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
115        \*--------------*/
116    /**
117     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
118     *
119     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
120     */
121    @SuppressWarnings( "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod" )
122    public ListBasedComparator( final K [] keys )
123    {
124        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
125    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
126
127    /**
128     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
129     *
130     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
131     */
132    public ListBasedComparator( final List<K> keys )
133    {
134        this( new SimpleKeyProvider<>(), null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
135    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
136
137    /**
138     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
139     *
140     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
141     *      {@link KeyProvider}
142     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
143     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
144     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
145     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
146     *      {@link Comparable}
147     *      interface.
148     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
149     */
150    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keys )
151    {
152        this( keyProvider, comparator, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ), null );
153    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
154
155    /**
156     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
157     *
158     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
159     *      {@link KeyProvider}
160     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
161     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
162     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
163     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
164     *      {@link Comparable}
165     *      interface.
166     *  @param  keys    The sort order keys.
167     */
168    @SafeVarargs
169    public ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final K... keys )
170    {
171        this( keyProvider, comparator, null, requireNonNullArgument( keys, "keys" ) );
172    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
173
174    /**
175     *  Creates a new {@code ListBasedComparator} instance.
176     *
177     *  @param  keyProvider The implementation of
178     *      {@link KeyProvider}
179     *      that returns the sort keys for the instances to compare.
180     *  @param  comparator  The comparator that is used to order the instances
181     *      that are not listed; if {@code null}, those are ordered randomly in
182     *      a non-consistent way if they or their keys do not implement the
183     *      {@link Comparable}
184     *      interface.
185     *  @param  keysList    The sort order keys in a list; is {@code null} when
186     *      {@code keysArray} is not {@code null}.
187     *  @param  keysArray   The sort order keys in an array; is {@code null}
188     *      when {@code keysList} is not {@code null}.
189     */
190    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod"} )
191    private ListBasedComparator( final KeyProvider<T,K> keyProvider, final Comparator<? super T> comparator, final List<K> keysList, final K [] keysArray )
192    {
193        assert isNull( keysList ) ^ isNull( keysArray ) : "Both, keysList and keysArray are either null or not null";
194
195        //noinspection SuspiciousArrayCast
196        m_Keys = nonNull( keysList ) ? (K []) keysList.toArray() : keysArray.clone();
197        m_KeyProvider = requireNonNullArgument( keyProvider, "keyProvider" );
198        m_Comparator = comparator;
199    }   //  ListBasedComparator()
200
201        /*---------*\
202    ====** Methods **==========================================================
203        \*---------*/
204    /**
205     *  {@inheritDoc}
206     */
207    @SuppressWarnings( {"unchecked", "rawtypes"} )
208    @Override
209    public final int compare( final T o1, final T o2 )
210    {
211        var retValue = 0; // Assuming that the values are equal …
212        if( o1 != o2 ) // Not identical …
213        {
214            /*
215             *  Retrieve the keys and get the index for the respective key. A
216             *  value of -1 (NOT_FOUND) indicates that the key was not found in
217             *  the list of keys and that the natural order should be used for
218             *  the respective entry.
219             */
220            final var key1 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o1 );
221            final var index1 = searchKey( key1 );
222            assert index1 == NOT_FOUND || index1 >= 0;
223            final var key2 = m_KeyProvider.getKey( o2 );
224            final var index2 = searchKey( key2 );
225            assert index2 == NOT_FOUND || index2 >= 0;
226
227            if( index1 == index2 )
228            {
229                /*
230                 *  If both index values are not -1, this means that the keys
231                 *  are equals and therefore the instances are to be treated
232                 *  as equals, too.
233                 */
234                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
235                {
236                    //---* Both are not in the list *--------------------------
237                    //noinspection IfStatementWithTooManyBranches
238                    if( nonNull( m_Comparator ) )
239                    {
240                        //---* Use the comparator if we have one *-------------
241                        retValue = signum( m_Comparator.compare( o1, o2 ) );
242                    }
243                    else if( key1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
244                    {
245                        //---* Use the implicit natural order *----------------
246                        retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( key2 ) );
247                    }
248                    else if( (o1 != key1) || (o2 != key2) )
249                    /*
250                     * Yes, we know that we do check for *identity* here! If
251                     * no explicit KeyProvider was given, the SimpleKeyProvider
252                     * is used, and that will return o# as Key#. This would
253                     * mean that we have performed the action below already
254                     * above …
255                     */
256                    {
257                        if( o1 instanceof Comparable comparable )
258                        {
259                            retValue = signum( comparable.compareTo( o2 ) );
260                        }
261                    }
262                    else
263                    {
264                        /*
265                         * We have no idea how to order, so we just compare the
266                         * hashcodes of the keys.
267                         */
268                        retValue = Long.signum( (long) key1.hashCode() - (long) key2.hashCode() );
269                    }
270                }
271            }
272            else
273            {
274                /*
275                 * That one that is in the list is less than the other one.
276                 */
277                if( index1 == NOT_FOUND )
278                {
279                    retValue = 1;
280                }
281                else if( index2 == NOT_FOUND )
282                {
283                    retValue = -1;
284                }
285                else
286                {
287                    /*
288                     * That one that is closer to the beginning of the list is
289                     * less than the other one.
290                     */
291                    retValue = signum( index1 - index2 );
292                }
293            }
294        }
295
296        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
297        return retValue;
298    }   //  compare()
299
300    /**
301     *  Searches the given key in the list.
302     *
303     *  @param  key The key.
304     *  @return The index in the list or
305     *      {@link ToolKit#NOT_FOUND}
306     *      ({@value ToolKit#NOT_FOUND})
307     *      if the key is not in the list.
308     */
309    private int searchKey( final K key )
310    {
311        /*
312         * Although using Arrays.binarySearch() looked a good idea at first
313         * place, it does not work as we are not allowed to sort the key's
314         * array, for obvious reasons.
315         */
316        var found = false;
317        var retValue = m_Keys.length;
318        while( !found && (--retValue >= 0) )
319        {
320            found = (key == m_Keys [retValue]) || (nonNull( key ) && key.equals( m_Keys [retValue] ));
321        }
322
323        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
324        return retValue;
325    }   //  searchKey()
326}
327//  class ListBasedComparator
328
329/*
330 *  End of File
331 */
